_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



Accidental Release Prevention 

Pinnacle Agriculture Distribution, Inc. is committed the safety of its employees, the public and the environment. This facility will make efforts to prevent an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia through proper equipment use, regular inspections/maintenance and adequate training of employees working with and around the regulated chemical. In the event an accidental release occurs, we have worked with the Danevang Fire Department to coordinate a response effort by them. This facility is included on the community emergency response plan through the Wharton county LEPC. 



Facility

This facility is a typical retail ag facility that stores and distributes agriculture chemicals and fertilizer to local farmers. This facility currently stores anhydrous ammonia in bulk tanks. 



Prevention Program

This facility uses a combination of  standards both federal and state requirements as well as industry best management practices to ensure we are making our best effort to minimize the risk of an accidental release. 



Five-year Accident History

No known accidents involving this facility within the previous five-year history.



Emergency Response

This facility has implemented an emergency action plan and the employees of this facility will not respond to accidental releases other than very minor incidental releases. The emergency action plan was written to ensure employee safety and call for offsite, trained responders. This facility will rely on the efforts of the Danevang Fire Department for response to accidental release emergencies. This facility is also included on the Wharton county LEPC community emergency response plan. Contact was made with both the fire department and the LEPC to coordinate plans. 



Planned Changes to Improve Safety

There are plans to have this system evaluated by a qualified professional to identify improvements needed to ensure compliance with all applicable regulatory requirements as

well as to ensure safety of our employees, the public and the environment. Improvements will be made accordingly. 



CES
